text: The 2014 Indian general election in Chhattisgarh was held in three phases on 10, 17 and 24 April 2014. ==Result== |- align=center !style="background- color:#E9E9E9" class="unsortable"| !style="background-color:#E9E9E9" align=center|Political Party !style="background-color:#E9E9E9" |Seats won !style="background-color:#E9E9E9" |Seat change |- |align="left"|Bharatiya Janata Party||10|| |- |align="left"|Indian National Congress||1|| |- | |align="left"|Total||11|| |} ==List of elected MPs== {|class="sortable wikitable" style="margin: 1em 1em 1em 0; background: #f9f9f9; border: 1px #aaa solid; border-collapse: collapse; font-size: 95%;" ! No. ! Constituency ! Turnout% ! Name of elected M.P. ! Party affiliation |- ! 1 | Surguja |77.96 | Kamalbhan Singh Marabi | bgcolor=#FBB917 | Bharatiya Janata Party |- ! 2 | Raigarh |76.60 | Vishnu Deo Sai | bgcolor=#FBB917| Bharatiya Janata Party |- ! 3 | Janjgir-Champa |61.54 | Kamla Devi Patle | bgcolor=#FBB917 | Bharatiya Janata Party |- ! 4 | Korba |73.95 | Banshilal Mahto | bgcolor=#FBB917 | Bharatiya Janata Party |- ! 5 | Bilaspur |63.07 | Lakhan Lal Sahu | bgcolor=#FBB917 | Bharatiya Janata Party |- ! 6 | Rajnandgaon |74.04 | Abhishek Singh | bgcolor=#FBB917 | Bharatiya Janata Party |- ! 7 | Durg |67.94 | Tamradhwaj Sahu | bgcolor=#00FFFF | Indian National Congress |- ! 8 | Raipur |65.68 | Ramesh Bais | bgcolor=#FBB917 | Bharatiya Janata Party |- ! 9 | Mahasamund |74.61 | Chandulal Sahu (Chandu Bhaiya) | bgcolor=#FBB917 | Bharatiya Janata Party |- ! 10 | Bastar |59.32 | Dinesh Kashyap | bgcolor=#FBB917 | Bharatiya Janata Party |- ! 11 | Kanker |70.22 | Vikram Usendi | bgcolor=#FBB917 | Bharatiya Janata Party |- |} ==References== Category:Indian general elections in Chhattisgarh Category:2010s in Chhattisgarh Category:2014 Indian general election by state or union territory
